TopicTitle: Any confirmation on a rumor floating around about a rare retail boxed copy of Kerbal Train Program?

Articles.Content:
Yes, I have been hearing secret rumors behind Kerbal Train Program, the predecessor to this game. One of the conductors/engineers in that game supposedly contains Bill Kerman's Great Grandfather who was behind the design of the very first Hype Train. Screenshots would be handy in confirming this rumor. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I would love to see Kerbal Train Program since I have heard it is incredibly rare to find.
Is that an April fools joke?

> 
> Is that an April fools joke?

Of course it is not. :-P
No I got one off eBay. I'm afraid to open it because I think it'll lose its value. When I get home I'll take a pic.

A friend gave me his copy on Steam right before he had to quit playing video games altogether. He wouldn't say where he got it, but I'm downloading it right now!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-01T13:38:16Z" title="04/01/2015 01:38  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 1, 2015</time> by Maximus97**

Kerbal Train Program was a nice step up from Kerbal Hiker.

Of course, nobody can forget the classic Kerbal Kavemen.
I remember the good ol' days of Kerbal Zygote Program too. Now THAT was an... interesting game.
Kerb Meier's Kerbal Kreator was the best god-sim ever.
I still remember Super Jeb Bro's. An old game for the Kerbal Entertainment System (KES)

I have some screenshots! It looks cool...

![iFzGtNW.png](http://i.imgur.com/iFzGtNW.png)
No one can forget Kerbal Sub-Atomic Particle Program ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Kerbal Grass Simulator

That was fun

Really

> 
> Kerbal Grass Simulator
> That was fun
> 
> Really

I've heard of that, but I decided not to get it after the release of the Kario Kart 8.

GGGAAAAAIIIIII!!!! I HATE APRIL FOOLS DAY!!!!! ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

lol, you got me again!

Pfft. You kids and your computer games. I remember the original "Kerb-All" model rockets released by Estes in I think it was 1996. They were miniature model rockets meant to be safely launched from a sidewalk, hence the name, but the thin construction made them prone to Rapid Unplanned Disassembly so they stopped selling them. But I believe some surplus ones got flogged off in Mexico in the early noughties and that's when Harvester got his start in rocketry.
Oh man can't wait to get my hands on it!

> 
> No I got one off eBay. I'm afraid to open it because I think it'll lose its value. When I get home I'll take a pic.

Exposure to light may damage the veiner, you should just paint a picture instead.
I forgot all about that after the announcement of Kerbal Space Marines.

> 
> Yes, I have been hearing secret rumors behind Kerbal Train Program, the predecessor to this game. One of the conductors/engineers in that game supposedly contains Bill Kerman's Great Grandfather who was behind the design of the very first Hype Train. Screenshots would be handy in confirming this rumor. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> I would love to see Kerbal Train Program since I have heard it is incredibly rare to find.

He wasn't Bill Kerman's Great Grandfather, he was Bill Clinton's Great Great Grandfather. It was a true story. I've seen *The Hyperocket*, whoch is *not* a rocket, but rather a Hype-converted engine based on the spare boiler for Stephenson's *Rocket*. It's very neat.
Oh, the memories of these oldies game you mentioned. I just had to boot my Dosbox and play K-COM Kerbal Defence and then the original (and remake) Kerbal Breed
Incidentally, i've decided that Lucida Console is 1000000000% more professional than comic sans.
